website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive, stylish, and sporting plenty of room for every bird visiting your backyard, this surprisingly durable bird bath was designed to last.
cons: this is a lightweight bird bath

customer_reviews.title: Pretty
customer_reviews.text: Nice look for my garden. Made of resin, so I hope it lasts in the FL sun. I poured pea gravel into the base to make it sturdier. So far, a great buy! UPDATE: After using this bird feeder for a month, the paint in the inside bowl is flaking off the birdbath and there are gold flecks floating around in the water. I have not submitted the bird bath to any harsh scrubbing, only rinsing it out and replacing the water about every two days. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: APB123

customer_reviews.title: My birdbath brings all the birds to my yard
customer_reviews.text: It feels pretty flimsy, it is VERY much plastic. Also it's a little crooked. Those are the only reasons I took a star off. Other than that, it LOOKS great. Unless you actually physically handle it, there's no reason anyone would suspect it's plastic. It's also easy to clean, I use a scrub brush and a little dish soap, and it's clean within 2 minutes. The birds like it, they use it, so it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Cat R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with this birdbath. I've wanted one a long time, but the cost has always kept me from getting one. This is amazing, especially for the price. Looks like metal once you fill it with water. It comes with posts to put in the ground, if you're worried about wind. I put a few rocks around mine. Looks AWESOME! 🐦 ***please note, I added the solar powered floating fountain in the photos - bought separately. Also amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Light weight easy to move, added solar fountain.. birds love it and so do I
customer_reviews.author: dorothy olivera

customer_reviews.title: Resin Issue
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased resin birdbaths for years and have to replace them almost every season because of our hard water and algae buildup. When I bought this, I also bought cleaner for algae in birdbaths. This arrived with two areas of the bowl badly sealed, so we knew it would be vulnerable right away no matter how we tackle the algae. It's very pretty and the same design we've purchased from other sellers for years. We're going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bird bath. Looks beautiful and looks much costlier than it was. Because We have strong winds sometimes, along with doves around at times, which are quite hefty so I did what others did. I put stones in the column to give it more weight. It’s now winter and do have it outside on patio because I feed and water my wonderful Golden Finch in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Stueven

customer_reviews.title: Need weight at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Very light have to put weight around the bottom so the wind doesn’t blow it over
customer_reviews.author: ClearfieldPap

customer_reviews.title: Reat birdbath
customer_reviews.text: This is a really attractive birdbath, great large size, lightweight resin, comes apart for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Cockeyed bird bath.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today. Assembly was straightforward and only took a couple of minutes. I like the look except for one thing. It lists badly to one side. I checked all of the connections and they were straight and flush but to get the bowl level I had to put 3/8" shims on one side of the base. I can't tell if the base is warped or if the threads on the connectors are out of alignment but the whole thing is cockeyed. If I tried to use it as I received it, the water would pour over one side. Can I make adjustments to make it work? Yes. But I shouldn't have to. 1
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile
customer_reviews.text: So fragile. Cracked connector between pole and dish. Buy something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklynshops

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing part for the pole upon arrival. No contacting VIVOHOME as with most sellers to get missing part.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Looks cheap, and it’ll be in a landfill soon
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. The first one I ordered had a small hole in the center of the birdbath. It leaked water through the hollow support pedestal. Poor quality control letting a product get shipped to a customer in non working condition. My second complaint is that it looks very cheap as well. Sure from a distance it might look like a quality birdbath but up close it looks like cheap plastic(resin) which it is. I actually paid $37.50 for the birdbath on 4/23/2020 the price is now at $42.50. I wouldn’t spend more than $25.00 for this. Bottom line this isn’t going to last long with how poor the quality it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: It's a very cheap plastic so if you are expecting any kind of quality or weight then look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but cheap; not good for solar fountain insert use (optional)
customer_reviews.text: Great little birdbath, but unfortunately the stem did not thread properly into the base when I was first assembling it. I ended up forcing it to fit, but the plastic of the collar cracked and I had to glue it to repair it. Not sure it'll last more than a single season, but works ok for now. Word to the wise: a commonly-paired solar fountain likely and regrettably WON'T work very well in this small birdbath (fountain doesn't suction properly into bowl, so it drifts and spouts water over the side; pump will fail if water is not present.)
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Large crack in basin of bird bath - 4 months in use!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Vivohome28 bird bath for 4 months (November to February) and it has developed a large crack in the basin. All the water leaks out in about 10 minutes. We've hade some below freezing nights, but one would think that a well-made bird bath could withstand temperature differences. Basically, I'm completely dissatisfied with this product. It's a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: perfect little bird bath for small area
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of humming birds and others in our backyard, and wanted to provide them with water for drinking and bathing. Since we weren't sure if they'd use it or not, we didn't want to spend a ton. This bath was inexpensive, very lightweight, and easy to put together. We didn't notice any birds in it right away, so we bought a little solar pump to make the water move (sometimes they need to 'see' it) and now it's the perfect addition to our garden. It is small, so we had to fix the fountain/pump to not be shooting up so high (and losing all the water) but it's a nice little bath! Bring on the birds!!
customer_reviews.author: M Winter

customer_reviews.title: I like the fountain
customer_reviews.text: I like the fountain, it is made out of plastic, but it is sturdy plastic, it looks like metal though. It looks really nice in my front yard, and the birds are coming to drink from it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Nice .
customer_reviews.text: I was looking good bird bath, and it is I Like this bird bath Nice size and nice color .It is a attractive bird bath.make more attractive to my front yard . It is made out of plastic but well-made.It's light weight.but durable and looks great in the yard. easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Reha

customer_reviews.title: Pebbles and Depth
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty and easy to assemble. Be sure to put stones in the bowl to give your feathered friends a choice of bathing depths and for small birds to land since the bottom may be too slippery for them to feel at ease. For birds to feel comfortable using the birdbath the water should not be more than two or three inches deep.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: SO, SO, LIGHT - Needs Sand
customer_reviews.text: This birdbath is PAPER LIGHT. However, the stem is constructed in a way that we were able to fill it with sand. The sand, and the pins that are provided to anchor it, have kept it from tipping over so far (and we had a pretty windy day yesterday). The bath is beautiful and it does look like copper. The look is just what we were hoping for. I actually expected it to be slightly heavier when considering the price (thus the 4 stars). I didn't understand how "plastic" polyresin was. If you are not placing this in dirt/mulch where you can anchor it, I would look for something heavier. Otherwise it's a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Radabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's lightweight and easy to assemble. I didn't expect it to be made of plastic, but you really can't tell. It looks beautiful in my front yard!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mistretta

customer_reviews.title: Great Resin Birdbath - assembles in 5 minutes - use J Hooks to anchor to ground
customer_reviews.text: Great outside birdbath, looks like aged copper, but it made of plastic resin. Screw together in 3 parts. Looks great. It is lightweight So you will want to use the 3 metal J hooks to anchor the base to the ground or it could tip over. We use ours as a winter bird bath in the Midwest where it freezes. We have a little 35 watt submersible heater That turns on below 35 degrees. Birdies need fresh water Is critical item in winter as there is no fresh water.
customer_reviews.author: duffmeister50

customer_reviews.title: Birds seem to like it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an inexpensive bird bath, this is perfect. Made of hard plastic, screws together and finish product looks good. My only compliant is that the bowl is glued on a little crooked but not enough to annoy the birds. I did not order the solar fountain, but I think I will now to keep the water moving so mosquitos are not attracted to it. Birds seem to like it and have not voiced any complaints, so I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: CWood

customer_reviews.title: Looks lovely!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this purchase. I really wanted a ceramic bird bath, but I fear the problems of cracking and chipping or altogether, breaking if tipped over. I placed ours in the flower bed garden along with a solar movable fountain and the enzymes for keeping the water and bird bath clean. Lots of compliments and fun to watch the fountain move about by the sun. Great product for the price. Sturdy enough. One can always layer decorative rocks on the bottom, if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshadow

customer_reviews.title: Larry's Take
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Made from solid plastic material. Looks good. Best part is its light and easy to move around. All I need do is empty the water each night and put back in place the next morning. This way I can keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Grifffiths

customer_reviews.title: Pleasntly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I received this. I put it together in 5 minutes. The sections screw together so there is no wobble and the base is wide enough to provide stability. If wind becomes a problem I'll just add a couple of small bricks to lay on the base. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an inexpensive bird bath espicially if you live in a northern climate. Our last one was ceramic and didn't fare too well with freezing temps plus it was very heavy to move when mowing the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: John Morgan

customer_reviews.title: more stable than expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect a resin birdbath to be this stable, but the construction is perfect, with threaded connections between parts instead of just "push together" and stakes to help hold it down included, this is a well made piece .. now just need the birds to discover it!!
customer_reviews.author: HippyCowGirl

customer_reviews.title: NO BIRDS.
customer_reviews.text: This has been in my yard for almost a month. It replaced a clay one which broke. I should have listened to myself! Stop buying junk from China. When I was putting it together I didn't like the materials used but went ahead anyway. I washed with warm water and soap several times. I changed the water over and over. Then it dawned on me! Chemicals!! They are leaching into the water and the birds know it. Years ago there was a warning put out about plastic and metal bowls from China. DO NOT use for food or water!! This is going in the trash and I will buy a clay one and NOT from CHINA
customer_reviews.author: Raidergrode

customer_reviews.title: Natural looking and functional
customer_reviews.text: The best part of this birdbath is the look. The green antique finish blends in with surrounding bushes. And the lip is easy for birds to rest on. A concern was the light weight, but you can fill the base with sand - which we did. It's stable that way. There are anchors that you can push into the ground for added stability. The tray screws on easily - which is helpful. But we're wondering if it will unscrew for winter clean out. The bath holds 2 gallons - that's a lot - the gentle slope to the tray does make it easy to "flush out" with a container of water or hose. It's a plus in our yard.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Looks elegant and is sturdier than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was disconcerted by the packing box which said in huge letters on both sides GRADEN BIRD BATH. Assembly was straightforward but a bit hard to get the parts lined up absolutely exactly in order to screw them together. I ended up reversing steps 1 and 2 and fiddling quite a long time to get step 3 to work, but the end result is attractive and sturdy. Sadly, though, the solar-powered fountain pump I purchased for it does not adhere to the basin surface. Nonetheless, the bath is attractive and I hope the birds will find it and like it soon.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fairly sturdy plastic. Finish looks good. Some reviews were concerned about the fit between the pieces. They are screw together and the one I recieved went together fine. Maybe others had bad units or were crossing the threads when screwing together. I did put rocks in the base to help with weight. Spikes seem fine. I don't anticipate any issues with it tipping.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine & Mick

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool Item
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a metal bird bath. Easy to set up (really easy). Parts fit well. Packaging was easy to open. Very light. As suggested by others, put rocks down the center tube for more stability.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice gardener. I basically just got so bored during (virus) lock down that I went to war with the weeds in my backyard. I purchased seeds to start a garden. My eye caught some birds drinking & bathing in a dirty pothole puddle across the street. Hence the inspiration to buy this very lightweight & easy to assemble bird bath. I placed a separate purchase for a solar fountain that completes it. It's really quite soothing & kinda zen if you're into that kinda thing (let's be honest - we ALL need some zen these days). I will update with some pics & a video.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Renee

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second birdbath I have purchased and the second one to spring a leak after just a few months. The bath was carefully assembled per the instruction but both developed a leak around the center where the base is attached. Even though I thoroughly cleaned the bowl and trying to seal with silicone, it still leaked. The silicone peeled off after the water got under the silicone.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected... even better!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this bird bath. I wasn't to fond of it when I was shopping online but didn't want to pay the high price for stone, concrete etc. I just figured I would get it and if it was to "plasticy" looking I would send it back. Its beautiful and looks like aged metal! The weight is nice, not so flimsy it will fall over easily but yet light enough to easily move and clean. The price was so much better then what I would have paid for what I was originally looking for. Glad I took the chance because im very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Karen McNaughton

customer_reviews.title: Very Very good value
customer_reviews.text: This was so much more than what I expected. If you did pick it up to see how light was, you would never know it is made from a resin material. Very very sturdy, easy to put together, and the color is beautiful. A real bargain. In fact I going to order one for a friend
customer_reviews.author: Pam Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but wish it was more stable and assembled tighter.
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty and looks great in my yard. Love the color. Not very stable though. The three base pieces, connected easily, but never screwed down tight. I added some rocks inside the area just above the base to add some weight, which helps and I used the included tie down rods but will be adding some heavier and longer ones. We have a prevailing West wind soooo. Yes, I could have bought a cement or clay birdbath, but I can’t handle those by myself for cleaning. Overall I’m happy and the addition of a solar fountain is amazing. The birds are already coming closer and closer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jane

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 different style birdbaths. That being said, this one is by far the easiest one to keep clean. I like the depth of this style since the robins seem to love it the most. Sometimes up to 4 or 5 will be in there at a time! Other birdbaths are not as deep, which make those nice for smaller birds. My cats love watching out the window too! Definitely recommend this one! We have had some pretty good wind gusts. I put some sand/ small stones in bottom to give it some weight before attaching the top. No issues!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Mae Yingling

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This bird bath is advertised as light weight and it is. In fact it is so light weight I had to stake it to the ground to prevent it from falling over when anything heavier than a hummingbird landed on it. In addition, after only 4 months the finish is failing in the bowl. I don't imagine that is good for birds and is probably why they are no longer using this bird bath.
customer_reviews.author: Varuna

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Despite this being plastic, it's really beautiful. I filled it with black river rocks and added a solar "fountain" disk that just floats on the surface and circulates the water during the day. It's perfect and affordable. Don't forget to look into some kind of enzyme water additive (many are safe for animals) to make sure it doesn't get gunky over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using for alternative use
customer_reviews.text: Received in great condition in three pieces that screw into each other. I ordered the pretty bronze color and was not disappointed. I may use this as a bird bath next year but with the pandemic and Halloween I am actually using this as a candy bowl. I will place the candy in the top and use the stakes to keep it securely on my front lawn. Figured to keep everyone feeling comfortable with social distancing it was a good alternative for the kids and they can still get their candy.
customer_reviews.author: BusyBee

customer_reviews.title: Looks like metal
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this bird bath the first season. Unfortunately, something happened to it by the second season, even though it was stored in the shed. When I tried filling it with water the second season, there were MULTIPLE LEAKS EVERYWHERE!!!! I tried saving it by using a resin glue to fill the seams underneath, still leaks and you need to fill with water often. Be careful what epoxy or glue you use, it might poison the birds who drink the water. Don't really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Took a month to arrive. This is a piece of junk. I tried to skrew the stand into the base. The threads didnt fit. The whole thing cant weigh more than a pound. Dont waste your money. I will return this tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like metal
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Looks like metal at a distance. Looks great in the garden, a hit with the birds on a hot day. Haven’t had bad weather, but I hear you can add sand to pedestal to weigh it down. Nice size, not too small.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to rate at this time
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted to place the product in my arbor on my pavers, but it's too lightweight to do this. Can't really complain because I was warned this might be a problem. So I moved it under a tree where it has worked just fine, except to date, I've never seen a bird use it. That's probably because we have several cats that roam my neighborhood and maybe the birds don't feel safe using it. Who knows, but I plan to keep it because even if the birds don't use it, it's decorative.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter.
customer_reviews.text: I put my porcelain birdbath in the garage for the winter and this year decided to put out something that would withstand the weather. Some mornings I break the thin ice with a small hammer to replace the water, others I've had to crack thick ice on one side and slide the huge slab of ice onto the ground. Very stable with regular cleaning because you can stake it to the ground. It's a little shaky some mornings when I break and remove thick ice but it's still standing and holding up to some very strong winds in the Northeast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight Bird Bath
customer_reviews.text: Previous to purchasing this bath, I had a ceramic bird bath that was attractive, but very heavy, making cleaning a bit of a chore. When an opossum jumped onto the ceramic bath, it tipped over and shattered all over my deck. I purchased this bird bath because I like the color and the design. I especially like how light weight it is, allowing me to tip it over slightly to drain it for cleaning. Last month, we had a terrible storm with high winds. I was able to easily lift this bath and put it in a place away from the storm. This bath is a beautiful addition to my back deck, which is my refuge. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Double Nole

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I have ordered
customer_reviews.text: First, I am generally not a person to write reviews, but I am SO impressed with this product, I have to share my thoughts! It is very lightweight and I was very concerned that it would fall over easily in the wind. We live on a golf course, so windy conditions are frequent. I have used this product for several months now. It has not blown over at all! Not even during violent thunderstorms, when other objects went flying. And, I did not have a need to put in the ground stakes. This product looks great and is easy to put together. Due to how little it weights, it is super easy to empty and clean. I definitely recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Broccoletti

customer_reviews.title: Add stones or sand in the column.
customer_reviews.text: It is very light & I get a lot of wind in my backyard when we have storms. I filled the column with stones to give it extra weight & purchased more anchor spikes from Home Depot to anchor it more. I have not had any problems with it during storms. I love the color, wash it out twice a day with fresh water & clean it once a week. The birds love it. I have a variety of birds come to my feeders & drink & splash around in the birdbath.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic birdbath
customer_reviews.text: I love this birdbath and so do my birds and butterflies. I bought a solar fountain to use in it, and the birds love it even more. This birdbath is sturdy and looks fantastic in my flower bed. I recommend this to anyone that wants a nice birdbath.
customer_reviews.author: J.L Lansing-Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to put this in my garden on soil, but after the first day of sitting filled it was tilting. However, it's so lightweight you definitely need the included anchors, so you can't really put it on a brick or stone surface. I was able to prop it up by inserting a few sticks under parts of the base, but it's a tenuous solution at best. I wish the base was weightier to give the whole thing more solidity so it could be on a hard, level surface.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Plowden

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a ceramic birdbath that blew over and broke. This is much easier to manage, lightweight and not so breakable. It looks great in my yard. I filled the base with sand, then added plants to anchor the base, and it hasn't blown over once in the South Florida winds. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Plastic
customer_reviews.text: When there was resin mentioned I thought it would be a little more rigid but it's basically just plastic. The birds drink out of it but I've yet to see one bathe. It drops off abruptly and is deep. I'm disappointed in it.. Surprised it has so many good ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: It looks lovely in the garden, and looks like it is made of metal.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little bird bath. It was affordable, went together super easily, and it looks gorgeous in the garden. It looks like it is made from metal, not resin. I have a little solar powered pump that floats in the middle that circulates water and the birds love it. I highly recommend it. This is a quality product and some thought clearly went into its production. Brings me joy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmymac

customer_reviews.title: Only got 1 season out of these....
customer_reviews.text: Plastic poly resin construction, you get what you pay for.... I bought two of these, one cracked at the base (most likely my fault because I had sand in the pedestal part to try to provide more weight so this would stay standing during windy conditions) and the other one cracked inside the bowl which is not my fault. Only got one season out of these, very disappointed....
customer_reviews.author: oldsoul

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic service; attractive design
customer_reviews.text: Original birdbath arrived damaged; company replaced immediately. Sets up quickly. I wanted it on the deck, so the included stakes would not work. I tied it to a baluster to ensure it wouldn't tip over, as it was clear from the damaged one that a fall could be disastrous. Added a floating solar powered fountain to help prevent mosquitoes, and cuz it's attractive. The birds, bees, and feral cat all love it - as does our family!
customer_reviews.author: akindofmagick

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Although I only used the bowl of this birdbath, I have only rave reviews about it. I is beautiful. We are constantly looking out the window at it. The birds started using it as soon as I put water in it. I have plans for the base to help with another project.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hart

customer_reviews.title: bird bath
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reasonably priced and handsome looking bird bath. I put it together myself in ten minutes and it all went together easily. VERY good quality. Looks so nice in my back yard. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: This works well, but is much lighter than it looks.
customer_reviews.text: This looks really nice in our flower/butterfly garden and we could not have asked for a better bird bath at this price point. That said, it's really important to have solid/compact dirt for the 3 ground stakes to keep the bath from blowing over; or have the bath placed in an area with low/no wind. I would not recommend placing it on solid ground/concrete as it can tip over very easily without the stakes in the ground; we tried that approach first.
customer_reviews.author: JM & MD

customer_reviews.title: This is okay but
customer_reviews.text: A cute little birdbath, I was hoping it would be good to use with the solar fountain I purchased however this is not deep enough to retain the water the fountain sprays, it is sturdy& looks concrete for the price , very easy to put together. If you want a birdbath this is the one but if you want a to add a solar fountain to keep the water circulating- this is not the one
customer_reviews.author: LindaP

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful birdbath
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It's the perfect size for a small garden. It took about 2 minutes to screw the pieces together and it was ready to go. Although it's plastic, it's heavy enough that it stays put. I haven't had any issue with the wind here where I live. It's also beautiful. Although it's plastic, it looks like old, metal with green patina. I'm so glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this bird bath! It is lighter weight but still sturdy enough!! Comes with stakes to keep it in place. Birds seem to love it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Rega

customer_reviews.title: Customer pictures were great help
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it bases on customers reviews. It is beautiful,easy to set up,and instructions are easy to follow. The portions I did not understand I used customers pictures. With the hook on the ground the bird bath is secure from wind. The only thing I need are beautiful birds. I rarely use this phrase. I highly recommend this company.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rose

customer_reviews.title: The bids like it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a plastic birdbath thathat looks like metal, it come with some small stakes to secure it to the ground, it's a nice size and the birds love it. The only problem is that it is a little uneaven and the basin tilts to one side, this probably woui matter if it was on the ground but we are using it on our deck. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Minimee

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: But, I would like it deeper next time. We are in Colorado and the water evaporates in hours. Maybe I should just put seed in it. But, I think the squirrels will be able to jump in it. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful birdbath!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this bird bath. It took me 20 minutes to screw it together because one piece I had to screw on and off about 6 times in order for it to thread correctly. I was thinking I was going to have to return it and would have gotten a replacement but I finally got it to screw on evenly! This is the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. I think the 3 pins they give you to help hold it into the ground could be about 4 inches longer to actually have some effect. I plan to put rocks around it so this is of no concern to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy D Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Looks heavy and expensive
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how light this product was. I can pick up with one hand. But in the yard it looks like a good old fashion and expensive heavy duty bird feeder. Came with stakes to help hold it down in weather. The birds are loving in. Doesn't get hot in the sun like some metal bird baths do. Also doesn't grow funk and scum on it because of the make up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Balance for the Garden
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful birdbath that looks like metal but is plastic. One was damaged when a large tree branch fell and have replaced with the same. The shape is graceful and having a birdbath does make a huge difference to bring more birds to the yard. I can't imagine the garden without it now. Definitely worth the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: DMacP

customer_reviews.title: It's Cute
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and was easy to put together, it comes with 3 pegs to put in ground, I think 4 pegs would have been better and I did have to put a rock under to level fountain, it wasn't level unfortunately when on flat surface. Otherwise it's a great addition to my yard
customer_reviews.author: S. A.

customer_reviews.title: Classy piece
customer_reviews.text: Love this bird bath. Sturdy and was easy to assemble. I have mine 2 months out in the blistering tropical sun and no signs of fading or cracking. I’ve enhanced the look with a solar fountain and river rocks. Friends and family love it! The birds don’t seem to be using it but it’s such a beautiful accent and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Narinesingh

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful.  Doesn't look like plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I have several plastic birdbaths which serve well in the yard. This one is exceptional because it really looks like metal and is a breeze to assemble and keep clean. Comes with landscape staples to help stabilize it.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Petruncio

customer_reviews.title: Attractive but color doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Really attractive birdbath that looks nice in my backyard. Would give it a higher rating if the paint hadn’t started wearing off. Received it at the end of June and by the middle of August I can see the green paint wearing off. A month and a half and already the color is diminishing. And no, I didn’t scrub it. Too bad. I thought it would last longer. Don’t get the green color. Maybe you’ll have better luck with the bronze? Or maybe not.
customer_reviews.author: Sky goddess

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the yard, nice looking. I did put a UV protectorant on the fountain so hopefully that will help with the hot summers here in Texas. Like they state it is really easy to put together. Used the pins to secure it in the ground. I also purchased a solar pump which is not included. Overall happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Whoa. This bird bath exceed my expectations. It was very easy to put together (2 minutes - no tools). Looks very nice even though it is plastic. It is light so you’ll need to use the anchors provided or even put some rocks around the bottom for stability in a windy area. Very nice addition to my outdoor fire pit area.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Bird bath
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. Maybe even a little more lightweight. With our hard water, I do have to clean it often. Very easy to do. Can’t say the birds are all that attracted to it yet, but I’m hoping.
customer_reviews.author: G Simons

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up in sunlight
customer_reviews.text: As soon as the sun comes out, the support softens and bends. It is rather flimsy and I will be replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, easy assemble.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute bird bath. We put it in a raised flower bed and it looks lovely surrounded by all the colorful flowers. I wish the base was a bit heavier to provide more stability, but it’s easy to work around. They included small stakes to help. The finish is peeling a bit inside the birdbath unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Shih Tzu Mom

customer_reviews.title: Looks classy and like it is made out of stone
customer_reviews.text: It looks like it is a much more expensive bird bath than it actually costs. My wife did not realize it was made out of a plastic until I told her that it was made out of plastic. Thinking about adding a solar floating water fountain to it so it gains some more attention from the birds in my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Super inexpensive and made from plastic but you could never tell.. very good quality! Looks beautiful in my backyard with my birdfeeders..now waiting on a solar water fountain to go with it and keep the water from becoming stagnant and to complete the ensemble!!! This should last a very long time while not having to pay a fortune!!! Let the bird funtime begin!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Beginner Garden.
customer_reviews.text: So pretty! Looks like high quality but is economical for any basic garden! Not to light but not metal like heavy. Comes with stakes. Perfectly holds a solar fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Leaves Much to be Desired
customer_reviews.text: This resin bird bath is very stylish and is just the look I wanted in our back yard to attract birds. It is very unstable and a light wind knocked it over even full of water. We filled the stem with sand and have placed rocks around the base, which sort of took care of this issue...would have returned it but too much of a hassle. Buy only if you have a level concrete slab to place it on.
customer_reviews.author: purpleiciousdiver

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: This birdbath set-up very quickly and just as quickly the birds were using it. It is very lightweight, but the three anchors appear to be doing the job of keeping it in place. It has been in high winds two days in a row and is still in place. As another reviewer noted, the birds are using the cut-outs to grip the bowl and get drinks. It is shallow enough for bird bathing as well and I have seen many bees taking drinks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Addition to Yard
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this birdbath. It is an attractive verdigreen color, pleasing design, easy to assemble, and surprisingly strong but not heavy. My garden spot is not level, but a rock under the low side has taken care of the problem. Birds of several sizes are using the birdbath frequently as we are currently in a drought.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Kay

customer_reviews.title: Still looking good after 2 years in MI !
customer_reviews.text: This thing still looks like new...it's been outdoors through 2 years of MI weather...the plastic still has the gold look it had from day 1...the study base is held down with a couple of paving slabs (because is in the flow bed)...if it's on your patio or deck...you shouldn't need them.
customer_reviews.author: Macair

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! If looks heavy but it's not. It's a great size and looks great on my raised deck next go my birdfeeders. Love the holes around the perimeter - decorative and functional. Perfect sized basin, looks great, easy to assemble and great price. Perfect depth for a water wiggler.
customer_reviews.author: JMJ

customer_reviews.title: Birds like this
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive, super lightweight bird bath that looks nice and it's great taking camping or for at the family cabin. I put in a flat rock so smaller birds feel comfortable. They will hop on the rock to more easily get a drink. Hummingbirds will even use this bath if you put in a rock.
customer_reviews.author: WuZetian

customer_reviews.title: Bird Bath
customer_reviews.text: What you see is what you'll get. The birdbath looks heavy and made of stone, but it's super light-weight resin. It's very very simple to put together and looks great in my garden. It comes with these little stakes to keep it stable and balanced which is a nice touch. I'm very happy with this sweet birdbath.
customer_reviews.author: bookthief

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, but won't withstand desert heat
customer_reviews.text: This birdbath was easy to assemble (easier than taking it apart to return!) and it is attractive. However, it is very lightweight, such that I don't think it will withstand summer monsoons. Most importantly, I don't think it will withstand the scorching summer heat in the southwestern desert.
customer_reviews.author: drcmb

customer_reviews.title: My second purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a second purchase of the similar bird bath. The former birdbath succumbed to the several years of weather. The bowl on this product is deeper than the traditional concrete based bird baths, which gives the birds a bigger water splash during the hot weather months.
customer_reviews.author: V. S. 3

customer_reviews.title: Foul  chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: II washed it and rinsed it numerous times but it still had a very foul chemical smell that did not diminish over time and I was frankly worried about whether it was even safe for the birds to drink. Of course I never saw any birds using it so I don't know if it is actually toxic. But I would never drink from a container made of the stuff. It's very light and has to be firmly anchored. I used rocks but the racoons still toppled it several times and the last time it fell the basin cracked, which took care of the toxicity concern. I don't recommend it. It It is very nice looking though.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at so many birdbaths before I decided on this one. I was very hesitant because I was afraid it would look like cheap plastic. I'm glad to say that I had nothing to be afraid of at all!! It looks great and even up close you can't tell...looks exactly like a patina finish on metal. It's sturdy, especially after filling the tube up with rocks. I added a solar fountain which makes me love it even more!! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: First, it's a cute birdbath but it's ridiculously lightweight. The stakes that came with it were about 3 inches long so pretty useless in our sandy soil. Even with rocks in the base, it wouldn't stand up. We finally put it on the edge of our patio and placed a potted plant on it so it wouldn't tip over in the wind. I guess I should have know as I typically spend about $100 or more for birdbaths. On the plus side, it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A. Black

customer_reviews.title: For my feathered friends.........
customer_reviews.text: I like this one because it is tall and I can see it from the window when I am inside the house. I have it in the shade under some overhanging branches so the birds feel safer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty bird bath
customer_reviews.text: Love the bird bath. I also bought the solar water fountain to go with it for my hummingbirds. However, the fountain splashes all of the water out of it, while it floats around. Will be returning the fountain, but will keep this bird bath. Would recommend the bath.
customer_reviews.author: Karen McHenry

customer_reviews.title: So far I love this bird bath that I've upgraded to a fountain
customer_reviews.text: I was able to add a solar fountain / pump (sold separately) and it looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: BautistaVids

customer_reviews.title: Really nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these years ago and like it a lot. My son and his wife recently bought a house so we gave them one of these birdbaths. I like it because it can easily be moved to another location. Not heavy like a concrete bath. We got the verdigris. It truly looks like metal. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Bexter

customer_reviews.title: Birdbath into a fountain.
customer_reviews.text: I turned it into a birdbath fountain. I have it weighted down. It's not very heavy so it would probably blow over. We'll see how long it lasts. I live in the desert. I had a fountain and the hummingbirds loved it. Then I switched it out with ne of those globe fountains and never got any hummingbirds so I'm going to try this with a steady bubbling head.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: My wife couldn’t wait for me to assemble the bird bath so she did it herself, she thought it was easy using the directions supplied. It was light weight enough for her to place it in the garden and I used the supplied pegs to stabilize it. We are both happy about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this birdbath but it was very disappointing. The birdbath softens in the heat. When it softens, it leans to one side. You can turn it and it will soften and even out....then lean to the other side. I purchased this for myself for my birthday in March. Once the July heat came to Virginia it was useless to me. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: Besides the very outer perimeter, The dish has no ridges or places for the birds to grasp. They weren't using it, sliding down into the bowl. I took a utility knife and cut deep ridges throughout the sides and bottom on the bowl. Now they can get a 'foot' hold and are using it.
customer_reviews.author: john smith

product_meta.title: VIVOHOME 28 Inch Height Polyresin Lightweight Antique Outdoor Garden Bird Bath Green
feature_bullets: AN ATTRACTIVE ADDITION - This bird bath is designed with an intimate European royal style with a bronzed patina and a hollow base that makes it lightweight and easy to move; Turn your garden or courtyard into an elegant and charming space
DURABLE DESIGN - Made of high-quality PP material and covered with resin coating, this bird bath resists rain, water, and other weather, and won’t dent, break, or fracture
STURDY BASE - Equipped with 3 ground stakes to keep it in place, additionally you can fill the pedestal with gravel or stones for improving the stability

EASY TO ASSEMBLE - Constructed with simple components that makes it easy to assemble; The bowl is easy to attach by screwing it onto the base, while the base is hollow and convenient to fill with materials
LARGE DIAMETER - This birdbath diameter is 19.7 inches, which will hold enough water or food for your lovely avians and butterflies for neighbors to enjoy

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,360 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
